sources.name: Gemini Deep Research - In-Depth PC Analysis and Building Guide

entries.fact: VRM (Voltage Regulator Module) quality directly impacts CPU stability and overclocking headroom
entries.details: VRMs convert 12V input to ~1V for CPU. Higher phase count and better components provide cleaner power delivery, enabling higher sustained clocks. Budget boards may throttle high-end CPUs under sustained load.

entries.fact: DDR5 doubles bandwidth over DDR4 by implementing two independent 32-bit channels per DIMM
entries.details: DDR5 uses on-die ECC, integrated voltage regulators (PMIC), and dual channels per stick. Higher base frequencies (4800MHz+) but initially higher latencies. Bandwidth-sensitive workloads benefit significantly.

entries.fact: NVMe Gen5 SSDs achieve 14GB/s sequential read vs 7GB/s for Gen4
entries.details: PCIe 5.0 doubles per-lane bandwidth. Primarily benefits large file transfers and content creation. Gaming load times see diminishing returns past Gen3 speeds due to random IOPS being the bottleneck.

entries.fact: Undervolting reduces CPU/GPU power consumption and heat while maintaining same performance
entries.details: Modern chips are binned conservatively. Finding the lowest stable voltage (typically -50mV to -100mV) reduces power and thermals without affecting clocks. Some motherboards and tools allow automated curve optimization.

entries.fact: PCIe lane allocation from CPU vs chipset affects bandwidth and latency for expansion cards
entries.details: CPU-direct lanes provide lowest latency. Chipset lanes share bandwidth through DMI link. GPU should always use CPU lanes. NVMe drives benefit from CPU lanes for competitive gaming and content creation.

entries.fact: Dual-channel memory configuration doubles memory bandwidth and is critical for integrated graphics
entries.details: Single DIMM halves available bandwidth. Integrated graphics (AMD APU, Intel UHD) share system RAM and suffer 30-50% FPS loss with single-channel. Always use matched pairs in correct slots.

entries.fact: Thermal paste bridges microscopic gaps between CPU IHS and cooler for heat transfer
entries.details: Pea-sized amount in center spreads under mounting pressure. Too much creates insulating layer, too little leaves air gaps. Quality paste vs cheap can mean 2-5C difference under load.

entries.fact: High-end air coolers match 240mm AIOs in cooling performance with better reliability
entries.details: Quality tower coolers like Noctua NH-D15 match or beat 240mm AIOs. AIOs offer better aesthetics and RAM clearance but have pump failure risk. 360mm+ AIOs outperform all air coolers.

entries.fact: Separate PCIe power cables are required for GPU stability; daisy-chaining risks instability
entries.details: Modern GPUs have transient spikes exceeding rated TDP. Each 8-pin delivers 150W from PSU. Using separate cables ensures clean power delivery. 12VHPWR connectors must be fully seated to prevent melting.

entries.fact: Positive pressure (more intake than exhaust) reduces dust accumulation in PC cases
entries.details: Intake through filtered areas, exhaust through unfiltered. Slight positive pressure pushes air out through gaps instead of drawing dusty air in. GPU temps may be 2-5C higher but long-term maintenance is easier.
